qas.question: What year was Victorien Sardou's Madame Sans-Gêne written?
What year was Maurice Barrès's Les Déracinés written?
In what year was Edmond Rostand's L'Aiglon written?
In what year was André de Lorde and Gyp's Napoléonette written?

context: Datta (2005) shows that, following the collapse of militaristic Boulangism in <a0_0>the late 1880s<a0_0/>, the Napoleonic legend was divorced from party politics and revived in popular culture. Concentrating on two plays and two novels from the period—Victorien Sardou's Madame Sans-Gêne (<a1_0>1893<a1_0/>), Maurice Barrès's Les Déracinés (<a2_0>1897<a2_0/>), Edmond Rostand's L'Aiglon (<a3_0>1900<a3_0/>), and André de Lorde and Gyp's Napoléonette (<a4_0>1913<a4_0/>) Datta examines how writers and critics of the Belle Époque exploited the Napoleonic legend for diverse political and cultural ends.
